page.title: 06ALLERFORD MUSEUM
page.content: The old thatched Village School House at Allerford is the setting for the {West Somerset Museum.}Set up in 1983 by the{West Somerset Archeological Soc under Mrs Freeman-Archer it has many exhibits of 19th century farm implements,dairy equipment,household goods,old musical instruments and much Victoriana.One room has been left as the{Village Classroom}with desks writing equipment,toys and photographs of 60 years ago.A collection of old photographs arranged as Exmoor parishes adds interest to the exhibits Served mainly by volunteers,demon- strations of local crafts are given and there is a picnic area, refreshments being available. An interesting and educational look into the recent past.
